Name: Resignation of members of boards of directors of business improvement district management associations.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the resignation of members of boards of directors of business improvement district management associations

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
This Introduction was Re-referred to Committee by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations, State & Federal Legislation
This Introduction was Re-referred to Committee by Council to the Committee on Small Business

Summary: This bill would require any member of a board of directors of a business improvement district management association who intends to resign from such board to provide no fewer than 30 days’ notice prior to such resignation.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Section 25-414 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law number 82 for the year 1990, is amended by adding a new subdivision e to read as follows:
	(e) A member of the board of directors of a district management association who intends to resign from such appointment shall provide no fewer than 30 days' notice to such board prior to resigning from such appointment. Such requirement shall be incorporated in each district plan prepared pursuant to this chapter. 
      � 2. This local law takes effect immediately.
